bioghist.p: James Herbert Spencer (1870-1942) was the minister at United Presbyterian Church of Wooster, Ohio (1913-1940). His son, Donald Agnew Spencer (1904-1961), attended Pittsburgh-Xenia Theological Seminary, graduating in 1929. Spencer served as pastor in churches in Pittsburgh and Canonsburg, Pennsylvania, before becoming pastor of the Second Presbyterian Church in Chattanooga, Tennessee, in 1946. In 1956 became pastor of Hebron United Presbyterian Church in Pittsburgh.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers of James and Donald Spencer. Materials include: typed and manuscript sermons of James Herbert Spencer, 1916-1935 (many undated); typed sermons and notes for sermons by Donald A. Spencer, 1927-1960; copies of printed sermons, including sermons preached by Donald Spencer on the radio program "The Protestant Hour", 1951-1954; and a typescript of "The Medieval View of Merit" by Donald Spencer, 1929.
